channel.title: Portfolio Website for Rasul Rasulov
channel.description: Recent content on Portfolio Website for Rasul Rasulov

item.title: Analysis of Social Networks Use Among Adults in The US
item.description: General Social Survey (GSS) The General Social Survey (GSS) gathers data on American society in order to monitor and explain trends in attitudes, behaviours, and attributes. Many trends have been tracked for decades, so one can see the evolution of attitudes, etc in American Society. Using data from the 2016 GSS sample data we are attempting to estimate the values of population parameters of interest about US adults. The GSS sample data file has 2867 observations of 935 variables, but we are only interested in very few of these variables hence a smaller file is chosen.

item.title: Climate Change and Temperature Anomalies
item.description: Climate change and temperature anomalies If we wanted to study climate change, we can find data on the Combined Land-Surface Air and Sea-Surface Water Temperature Anomalies in the Northern Hemisphere at NASA’s Goddard Institute for Space Studies. The tabular data of temperature anomalies can be found here To define temperature anomalies you need to have a reference, or base, period which NASA clearly states that it is the period between 1951-1980.

item.title: Comparing Hollywood Directors: Steven Spielberg and Tim Burton
item.description: IMDB ratings: Differences between directors Recall the IMBD ratings data. We explore whether the mean IMDB rating for Steven Spielberg and Tim Burton are the same or not. We have already calculated the confidence intervals for the mean ratings of these two directors and as you can see they overlap. Before we start on with the analysis, it’s is always a good idea to check with skimr::skim() to get a feel for missing values, summary statistics of numerical variables, and a very rough histogram.

item.title: Suicide and Homicide Rates Among White Males in The US
item.description: knitr::opts_chunk$set( message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, tidy=FALSE, # display code as typed size="small") # slightly smaller font for code options(digits = 3) # default figure size knitr::opts_chunk$set( fig.width=6.75, fig.height=6.75, fig.align = "center" ) Challenge 1: Replicating a chart I have created a publication-ready plot using our dplyr and ggplot2 skills. The bubble chart that we replicated shows the position of the states in terms of the firearms related cases of homicide and suicide across white males.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
